meanings.sent1: He tried rooking his friend in a game of cards.
meanings.sent2: The scammer was rooking unsuspecting victims out of their money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was rooking the other animals out of their snacks.
meanings.sent4: The clever magician was rooking the audience with his illusions.
meanings.sent5: She felt betrayed when she realized her partner was rooking her in the business deal.

meanings.sent1: The con artist was rooking people with his fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent2: She was rooking her little brother into believing he had superpowers.
meanings.sent3: The prankster was rooking his friends with a fake spider.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox was rooking the other animals with his clever disguises.
meanings.sent5: The fortune teller was rooking her clients with vague predictions.

meanings.definition: To play a trick on someone
meanings.sent1: The kids were rooking their teacher by hiding his chalk.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed rooking her siblings by jumping out and scaring them.
meanings.sent3: The ghost costume was perfect for rooking unsuspecting guests at the party.
meanings.sent4: The clever prankster was rooking everyone with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent5: He was rooking his friends by pretending to be a famous celebrity.
